Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: gem

Arguments.Name: -V
Arguments.Description: Set the verbose level of output

Arguments.Name: --no-verbose
Arguments.Description: Do not set the verbose level of output

Arguments.Name: -config-file
Arguments.Description: Use this config file instead of default

Arguments.Name: install
Arguments.Description: Install a gem into the local repository

Arguments.Name: --platform
Arguments.Description: Specify the platform of gem to install

Arguments.Name: cert
Arguments.Description: Manage RubyGems certificates and signing settings

Arguments.Name: -l
Arguments.Description: List trusted certificates where the subject contains FILTER

Arguments.Name: -r
Arguments.Description: Remove trusted certificates where the subject contains FILTER

Arguments.Name: -b
Arguments.Description: Build private key and self-signed certificate for EMAIL_ADDR

Arguments.Name: -A
Arguments.Description: Select which key algorithm to use for --build

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Signs CERT with the key from -K and the certificate from -C

Arguments.Name: -R
Arguments.Description: Re-signs the certificate from -C with the key from -K

Arguments.Name: check
Arguments.Description: Check a gem repository for added or missing files

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: Report 'unmanaged' or rogue files in the gem repository

Arguments.Name: --no-alien
Arguments.Description: Report 'managed' or rogue files in the gem repository

Arguments.Name: --doctor
Arguments.Description: Clean up uninstalled gems and broken specifications

Arguments.Name: --no-doctor
Arguments.Description: Do not clean up uninstalled gems and broken specifications

Arguments.Name: --dry-run
Arguments.Description: Do not remove files, only report what would be removed

Arguments.Name: --no-gems
Arguments.Description: Check not installed gems for problems

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Specify version of gem to check

Arguments.Name: cleanup
Arguments.Description: Clean up old versions of installed gems

Arguments.Name: -D
Arguments.Description: Check development dependencies while uninstalling (default: true)

Arguments.Name: --no-check-development
Arguments.Description: Do not check development dependencies while uninstalling

Arguments.Name: --user-install
Arguments.Description: Cleanup in user’s home directory instead of GEM_HOME

Arguments.Name: --no-user-install
Arguments.Description: Cleanup in GEM_HOME instead of user’s home directory

Arguments.Name: contents
Arguments.Description: Display the contents of the installed gems

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Specify version of gem to contents

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Search for gems under specific paths

Arguments.Name: -l
Arguments.Description: Only return files in the Gem’s lib_dirs

Arguments.Name: --no-lib-only
Arguments.Description: Not only return files in the Gem’s lib_dirs

Arguments.Name: --show-install-dir
Arguments.Description: Show only the gem install dir

Arguments.Name: --no-show-install-dir
Arguments.Description: Do not show only the gem install dir

Arguments.Name: dependency
Arguments.Description: Show the dependencies of an installed gem

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Specify version of gem to dependency

Arguments.Name: --platform
Arguments.Description: Specify the platform of gem to dependency

Arguments.Name: --prerelease
Arguments.Description: Allow prerelease versions of a gem

Arguments.Name: --no-prerelease
Arguments.Description: Do not allow prerelease versions of a gem

Arguments.Name: -R
Arguments.Description: Include reverse dependencies in the output

Arguments.Name: --no-reverse-dependencies
Arguments.Description: Do not include reverse dependencies in the output

Arguments.Name: -l
Arguments.Description: Restrict operations to the LOCAL domain

Arguments.Name: -r
Arguments.Description: Restrict operations to the REMOTE domain

Arguments.Name: -B
Arguments.Description: Threshold for switching to bulk synchronization (default 1000)

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Append URL to list of remote gem sources

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Use HTTP proxy for remote operations

Arguments.Name: --no-http-proxy
Arguments.Description: Do not use HTTP proxy for remote operations

Arguments.Name: environment
Arguments.Description: Display information about the RubyGems environment

Arguments.Name: home
Arguments.Description: Display the path where gems are installed. Aliases: gemhome, gemdir, GEM_HOME

Arguments.Name: path
Arguments.Description: Display path used to search for gems. Aliases: gempath, GEM_PATH

Arguments.Name: user_gemhome
Arguments.Description: Display the path where gems are installed when --user-install is given. Aliases: user_gemdir

Arguments.Name: fetch
Arguments.Description: Download a gem and place it in the current directory

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Specify version of gem to fetch

Arguments.Name: --platform
Arguments.Description: Specify the platform of gem to fetch

Arguments.Name: --prerelease
Arguments.Description: Allow prerelease versions of a gem

Arguments.Name: --no-prerelease
Arguments.Description: Do not allow prerelease versions of a gem

Arguments.Name: --suggestions
Arguments.Description: Suggest alternates when gems are not found

Arguments.Name: --no-suggestions
Arguments.Description: Do not suggest alternates when gems are not found

Arguments.Name: -B
Arguments.Description: Threshold for switching to bulk synchronization (default 1000)

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Append URL to list of remote gem sources

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Use HTTP proxy for remote operations

Arguments.Name: --no-http-proxy
Arguments.Description: Do not use HTTP proxy for remote operations

Arguments.Name: generate_index
Arguments.Description: Generates the index files for a gem server directory

Arguments.Name: -d
Arguments.Description: Repository base dir containing gems subdir

Arguments.Name: --no-modern
Arguments.Description: Do not generate indexes for RubyGems

Arguments.Name: --update
Arguments.Description: Update modern indexes with gems added since the last update

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Show information for the given gem

Arguments.Name: -e
Arguments.Description: Name of gem(s) to query on matches the provided STRING

Arguments.Name: --prerelease
Arguments.Description: Allow prerelease versions of a gem

Arguments.Name: --no-prerelease
Arguments.Description: Do not allow prerelease versions of a gem

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Specify version of gem to list for use with --installed

Arguments.Name: lock
Arguments.Description: Generate a lockdown list of gems

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Fail if unable to satisfy a dependency

Arguments.Name: --no-strict
Arguments.Description: Do not fail if unable to satisfy a dependency

Arguments.Name: -e
Arguments.Description: Prepends COMMAND to gem path. Could be used to specify editor

Arguments.Name: pristine
Arguments.Description: Restores installed gems to pristine condition from files located in the gem cache

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Restore all installed gems to pristine condition

Arguments.Name: --skip
Arguments.Description: Restore all installed gems to pristine condition

Arguments.Name: --extensions
Arguments.Description: Restore gems with extensions in addition to regular gems

Arguments.Name: --no-extensions
Arguments.Description: Do not restore gems with extensions in addition to regular gems

Arguments.Name: -E
Arguments.Description: Rewrite executables with a shebang of /usr/bin/env

Arguments.Name: --no-env-shebang
Arguments.Description: Do not rewrite executables with a shebang of /usr/bin/env

Arguments.Name: -i
Arguments.Description: Gem repository to get binstubs and plugins installed

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Specify version of gem to restore to pristine condition

Arguments.Description: Query gem information in local or remote repositories

Arguments.Description: Name of gem(s) to query on matches the provided REGEXP

Arguments.Description: Do not display detailed information of gem(s)

Arguments.Description: Sign in to any gemcutter-compatible host. It defaults to https://rubygems.org

Arguments.Description: Digit code for multifactor authentication You can also use the environment variable GEM_HOST_OTP_CODE

Arguments.Description: Manage the sources and cache file RubyGems uses to search for gems

Arguments.Description: Do not show any confirmation prompts and behave as if 'yes' was always answered

Arguments.Description: Use HTTP proxy for remote operations

Arguments.Description: Do not use HTTP proxy for remote operations

Arguments.Description: Specify version of gem to examine

Arguments.Name: --platform
Arguments.Description: Specify the platform of gem to specification

Arguments.Name: --prerelease
Arguments.Description: Allow prerelease versions of a gem

Arguments.Name: --no-prerelease
Arguments.Description: Do not allow prerelease versions of a gem

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Output specifications for all versions of the gem

Arguments.Description: List gems along with access times

Arguments.Name: -v

Arguments.Name: yank
Arguments.Description: Remove a pushed gem from the index

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Specify version of gem to dependency

Arguments.Name: --platform
Arguments.Description: Specify the platform of gem to dependency

Arguments.Name: --otp
Arguments.Description: Digit code for multifactor authentication You can also use the environment variable GEM_HOST_OTP_CODE

Arguments.Name: uninstall
Arguments.Description: Uninstall gems from the local repository

Arguments.Name: -D
Arguments.Description: Check development dependencies while uninstalling (default: false)

Arguments.Name: --user-install
Arguments.Description: Uninstall from user’s home directory in addition to GEM_HOME

Arguments.Name: --format-executable
Arguments.Description: Assume executable names match Ruby’s prefix and suffix

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Uninstall all versions of the named gems ignoring dependencies

Arguments.Name: --abort-on-dependent
Arguments.Description: Prevent uninstalling gems that are depended on by other gems

Arguments.Name: -v
Arguments.Description: Specify version of gem to uninstall

Arguments.Name: --platform
Arguments.Description: Specify the platform of gem to uninstall

Arguments.Name: --vendor
Arguments.Description: Uninstall gem from the vendor directory. Only for use by gem repackagers

Arguments.Description: Display local gems whose name matches REGEXP

Arguments.Name: --no-details
Arguments.Description: Do not display detailed information of gem(s)

Arguments.Name: --no-update-sources
Arguments.Description: [Deprecated] Do not update local source cache

Arguments.Description: Name of gem(s) to query on matches the provided STRING

Arguments.Name: -s
Arguments.Description: Append URL to list of remote gem sources

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Use HTTP proxy for remote operations

Arguments.Name: --no-http-proxy
Arguments.Description: Do not use HTTP proxy for remote operations

Arguments.Name: build
Arguments.Description: Build a gem from a gemspec

Arguments.Name: --platform
Arguments.Description: Specify the platform of gem to build

Arguments.Name: --strict
Arguments.Description: Consider warnings as errors when validating the spec

Arguments.Name: -o
Arguments.Description: Output gem with the given filename

Arguments.Name: C
Arguments.Description: Run as if gem build was started in <PATH> instead of the current working directory

Arguments.Name: push
Arguments.Description: Push a gem up to the gem server

Arguments.Name: --otp
Arguments.Description: Digit code for multifactor authentication You can also use the environment variable GEM_HOST_OTP_CODE

Arguments.Name: -p
Arguments.Description: Use HTTP proxy for remote operations

Arguments.Name: --no-http-proxy
Arguments.Description: Do not use HTTP proxy for remote operations

Arguments.Name: server
Arguments.Description: Starts up a web server that hosts the RDoc (requires rubygems-server)

Arguments.Name: owner
Arguments.Description: Manage gem owners of a gem on the push server

Arguments.Name: -a
Arguments.Description: Add an owner by user identifier

Arguments.Name: -r
Arguments.Description: Remove an owner by user identifier

Arguments.Name: --otp
Arguments.Description: Digit code for multifactor authentication You can also use the environment variable GEM_HOST_OTP_CODE

Arguments.Name: which
Arguments.Description: Find the location of a library file you can require

Arguments.Name: outdated
Arguments.Description: Display all gems that need updates

Arguments.Name: --platform
Arguments.Description: Specify the platform of gem to outdated

Arguments.Name: update
Arguments.Description: Update installed gems to the latest version

Arguments.Name: --prerelease
Arguments.Description: Allow prerelease versions of a gem as update targets

Arguments.Name: --install-dir
Arguments.Description: Gem repository directory to get installed gems

Arguments.Name: --bindir
Arguments.Description: Directory where executables will be placed when the gem is installed

Arguments.Name: --build-root
Arguments.Description: Temporary installation root. Useful for building packages. Do not use this when installing remote gems

Arguments.Name: --vendor
Arguments.Description: Install gem into the vendor directory. Only for use by gem repackagers

Arguments.Name: --env-shebang
Arguments.Description: Rewrite the shebang line on installed scripts to use /usr/bin/env

Arguments.Name: --force
Arguments.Description: Force gem to install, bypassing dependency checks

Arguments.Name: --wrappers
Arguments.Description: Use bin wrappers for executables. Not available on dosish platforms

Arguments.Name: --ignore-dependencies
Arguments.Description: Do not install any required dependent gems

Arguments.Name: --format-executable
Arguments.Description: Make installed executable names match Ruby

Arguments.Name: --user-install
Arguments.Description: Install in user's home directory instead of GEM_HOME

Arguments.Name: --development-all
Arguments.Description: Install development dependencies for all gems (including dev deps themselves)

Arguments.Name: --conservative
Arguments.Description: Don't attempt to upgrade gems already meeting version requirement

Arguments.Name: --minimal-deps
Arguments.Description: Don't upgrade any dependencies that already meet version requirements

Arguments.Name: --file
Arguments.Description: Read from a gem dependencies API file and install the listed gems

Arguments.Name: --without
Arguments.Description: Omit the named groups (comma separated) when installing from a gem dependencies file

Arguments.Name: --default
Arguments.Description: Add the gem's full specification to specifications/default and extract only its bin

Arguments.Name: --explain
Arguments.Description: Rather than install the gems, indicate which would be installed

Arguments.Name: --lock
Arguments.Description: Create a lock file (when used with -g/--file)

Arguments.Name: --suggestions
Arguments.Description: Suggest alternates when gems are not found
